product_overview: The Sip-In Cafe frontend is a modern, responsive web application built with Next.js 15, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS. It provides an engaging user experience through a comprehensive set of components including homepage, menu, gallery, blog, and contact pages. The system integrates with Sanity CMS for dynamic content management and supports dark/light theme toggling, responsive design, and SEO optimization.
core_goals: Create a fast, responsive, and accessible web frontend for The Sip-In Cafe reflecting brand identity.
Integrate seamlessly with Sanity CMS for dynamic content delivery and management.
Provide rich user interactions with animations and smooth transitions using Framer Motion.
Ensure mobile-first responsive design with optimized layouts and touch-friendly interactions.
Implement robust error handling and loading states for reliable user experience.
Incorporate SEO best practices including meta tags, structured data, and performance.
Support theme toggling with system preference detection and persistence for dark and light modes.
key_features: Home Page featuring hero section, cafe info, special offers, testimonials, blog posts, and gallery preview.
Responsive Navigation with mobile hamburger menu, active page highlighting, and smooth animations.
Menu Page displaying categorized items with pricing, dietary info, and special offers.
Gallery System with image and video display, category filters, responsive masonry grid, and hover effects.
Dynamic Blog System supporting individual posts with rich text, SEO metadata, and error handling.
Contact Page with contact info display and a responsive contact form layout.
Floating Action Button providing quick access to order, call, and directions actions with animated toggle.
Loading Spinner component supporting multiple sizes and custom text for async operations.
Footer Component with contact info, opening hours, social links, and responsive layout.
Dark/Light Theme Toggle with system preference detection, local storage persistence, and accessibility enhancements.
Sanity CMS integration for fetching and managing all content types with graceful fallback data handling.
user_flow_summary: User lands on the Home Page, interacts with hero content, special offers, testimonials, and previews blog and gallery items.
User navigates via responsive Navigation bar to Menu, Gallery, Contact, or Blog sections.
User views Menu page with categorized items, selects specials, and reviews dietary/allergen information.
User explores the Gallery page filtering images/videos by category with interactive hover states.
User accesses Contact page to view contact details or fill the inquiry form.
User utilizes Floating Action Button to quickly place orders, call the cafe, or get directions.
User toggles between dark and light themes with preferences saved across sessions.
If fetching data fails, user experiences loading spinners and fallback content for continuity.
User accesses individual blog posts with enhanced reading experience and SEO metadata.
User encounters custom 404 page for non-existent routes with navigation back to home and menu.
validation_criteria: All pages render correctly with server-side fetched data or fallback content if CMS unavailable.
Navigation highlights active states correctly and mobile menu toggles as expected.
Menu items display accurate pricing, descriptions, and dietary info consistent with CMS data.
Gallery filtering functions correctly showing appropriate images/videos per category.
Blog posts load dynamically with proper SEO metadata and handle missing posts gracefully with 404 page.
Contact form fields present and layout adapts responsively across devices.
Theme toggle persists choice and respects system preferences across sessions.
Floating Action Button expands and triggers intended quick actions with smooth animations.
Loading Spinner appears during asynchronous operations across the app.
SEO meta tags, Open Graph, and structured data are present and valid for key pages.
Error boundaries and 404 page handle unexpected user navigation properly.
Accessibility features like keyboard navigation, ARIA labels, and color contrast pass standard audits.
Performance metrics meet targeted Core Web Vitals thresholds (LCP <2.5s, FID <100ms, CLS <0.1).
